</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/British_Library" title="British Library">British Library</a> is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_libraries" title="List of largest libraries">second largest library</a> in the world, and the <a href="/wiki/National_library" title="National library">national library</a> of the United Kingdom.<sup id="cite_ref-415" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-415"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>406<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> There are many other research libraries, including the <a href="/wiki/Wellcome_Library" title="Wellcome Library">Wellcome Library</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dana_Library_and_Research_Centre" class="mw-redirect" title="Dana Library and Research Centre">Dana Centre</a>, as well as <a href="/wiki/Academic_library" title="Academic library">university libraries</a>, including the <a href="/wiki/British_Library_of_Political_and_Economic_Science" title="British Library of Political and Economic Science">British Library of Political and Economic Science</a> at <a href="/wiki/London_School_of_Economics" title="London School of Economics">LSE</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Imperial_College_London_Abdus_Salam_Library" class="mw-redirect" title="Imperial College London Abdus Salam Library">Abdus Salam Library</a> at <a href="/wiki/Imperial_College_London" title="Imperial College London">Imperial</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Maughan_Library" title="Maughan Library">Maughan Library</a> at <a href="/wiki/King%27s_College_London" title="King&#39;s College London">King's</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Senate_House_Libraries" title="Senate House Libraries">Senate House Libraries</a> at the <a href="/wiki/University_of_London" title="University of London">University of London</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-416" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-416"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>407<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>In the latter half of the 19th century the locale of <a href="/wiki/South_Kensington" title="South Kensington">South Kensington</a> was developed as "<a href="/wiki/Albertopolis" title="Albertopolis">Albertopolis</a>", a cultural and scientific quarter. Three major national museums are there: the <a href="/wiki/Victoria_and_Albert_Museum" title="Victoria and Albert Museum">Victoria and Albert Museum</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Natural_History_Museum,_London" title="Natural History Museum, London">Natural History Museum</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/London_Science_Museum" class="mw-redirect" title="London Science Museum">Science Museum</a>. The <a href="/wiki/National_Portrait_Gallery,_London" title="National Portrait Gallery, London">National Portrait Gallery</a> was founded in 1856 to house depictions of figures from British history; its holdings now comprise the world's most extensive collection of portraits.<sup id="cite_ref-417" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-417"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>408<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> The national gallery of British art is at <a href="/wiki/Tate_Britain" title="Tate Britain">Tate Britain</a>, originally established as an annexe of the National Gallery in 1897. The Tate Gallery, as it was formerly known, also became a major centre for modern art. In 2000, this collection moved to <a href="/wiki/Tate_Modern" title="Tate Modern">Tate Modern</a>, a new gallery housed in the former <a href="/wiki/Bankside_Power_Station" title="Bankside Power Station">Bankside Power Station</a> which is accessed by pedestrians north of the Thames via the <a href="/wiki/Millennium_Bridge,_London" title="Millennium Bridge, London">Millennium Bridge</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-418" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-418"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>409<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Music">Music</h3></div>

<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG/220px-Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG/330px-Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8c/Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG/440px-Royal_Albert_Hall.001_-_London.JPG 2x" data-file-width="3264" data-file-height="2448" /></a><figcaption>The <a href="/wiki/Royal_Albert_Hall" title="Royal Albert Hall">Royal Albert Hall</a> hosts concerts and musical events, including the classical music festival <a href="/wiki/BBC_Proms" title="BBC Proms">The Proms</a> which are held every summer, as well as cinema screenings of films accompanied with live orchestral music.</figcaption></figure>

<p>London is one of the major classical and <a href="/wiki/Popular_music" title="Popular music">popular music</a> capitals of the world and hosts major music corporations, such as <a href="/wiki/Universal_Music_Group" title="Universal Music Group">Universal Music Group International</a> and <a href="/wiki/Warner_Music_Group" title="Warner Music Group">Warner Music Group</a>, and countless bands, musicians and industry professionals. The city is also home to many orchestras and concert halls, such as the <a href="/wiki/Barbican_Arts_Centre" class="mw-redirect" title="Barbican Arts Centre">Barbican Arts Centre</a> (principal base of the <a href="/wiki/London_Symphony_Orchestra" title="London Symphony Orchestra">London Symphony Orchestra</a> and the <a href="/wiki/London_Symphony_Chorus" title="London Symphony Chorus">London Symphony Chorus</a>), the <a href="/wiki/Southbank_Centre" title="Southbank Centre">Southbank Centre</a> (<a href="/wiki/London_Philharmonic_Orchestra" title="London Philharmonic Orchestra">London Philharmonic Orchestra</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Philharmonia_Orchestra" title="Philharmonia Orchestra">Philharmonia Orchestra</a>), <a href="/wiki/Cadogan_Hall" title="Cadogan Hall">Cadogan Hall</a> (<a href="/wiki/Royal_Philharmonic_Orchestra" title="Royal Philharmonic Orchestra">Royal Philharmonic Orchestra</a>), and the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Albert_Hall" title="Royal Albert Hall">Royal Albert Hall</a> (<a href="/wiki/The_Proms" class="mw-redirect" title="The Proms">The Proms</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-London&#39;s_Concerts_367-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-London&#39;s_Concerts-367"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>358<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> The Proms, an eight-week summer season of daily orchestral classical music first held in 1895, ends with the <a href="/wiki/BBC_Proms#Last_Night_of_the_Proms" title="BBC Proms">Last Night of the Proms</a>. London's two main opera houses are the <a href="/wiki/Royal_Opera_House" title="Royal Opera House">Royal Opera House</a> and the <a href="/wiki/London_Coliseum" title="London Coliseum">London Coliseum</a> (home to the <a href="/wiki/English_National_Opera" title="English National Opera">English National Opera</a>).<sup id="cite_ref-London&#39;s_Concerts_367-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-London&#39;s_Concerts-367"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>358<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> The UK's largest <a href="/wiki/Pipe_organ" title="Pipe organ">pipe organ</a> is at the Royal Albert Hall. Other significant instruments are in cathedrals and major churches—the church bells of <a href="/wiki/St_Clement_Danes" title="St Clement Danes">St Clement Danes</a> feature in the 1744 <a href="/wiki/Nursery_rhyme" title="Nursery rhyme">nursery rhyme</a> "<a href="/wiki/Oranges_and_Lemons" title="Oranges and Lemons">Oranges and Lemons</a>".<sup id="cite_ref-419" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-419"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>410<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Several <a href="/wiki/Conservatoire" class="mw-redirect" title="Conservatoire">conservatoires</a> are within the city: <a href="/wiki/Royal_Academy_of_Music" title="Royal Academy of Music">Royal Academy of Music</a>, <a href="/wiki/Royal_College_of_Music" title="Royal College of Music">Royal College of Music</a>, <a href="/wiki/Guildhall_School_of_Music_and_Drama" title="Guildhall School of Music and Drama">Guildhall School of Music and Drama</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Trinity_College_of_Music" class="mw-redirect" title="Trinity College of Music">Trinity Laban</a>. The record label <a href="/wiki/EMI" title="EMI">EMI</a> was formed in the city in 1931, and an early employee for the company, <a href="/wiki/Alan_Blumlein" title="Alan Blumlein">Alan Blumlein</a>, created <a href="/wiki/Stereo_sound" class="mw-redirect" title="Stereo sound">stereo sound</a> that year.<sup id="cite_ref-420" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-420"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>411<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Guitar amp engineer <a href="/wiki/Jim_Marshall_(businessman)" title="Jim Marshall (businessman)">Jim Marshall</a> founded <a href="/wiki/Marshall_Amplification" title="Marshall Amplification">Marshall Amplification</a> in London in 1962.<sup id="cite_ref-421" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-421"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>412<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<figure class="mw-default-size mw-halign-left" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg/250px-Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg" decoding="async" width="250" height="188" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg/375px-Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg/500px-Abbey_Rd_Studios.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3200" data-file-height="2400" /></a><figcaption><a href="/wiki/Abbey_Road_Studios" title="Abbey Road Studios">Abbey Road Studios</a> in <a href="/wiki/Abbey_Road,_London" title="Abbey Road, London">Abbey Road</a></figcaption></figure>

<p>London has numerous venues for rock and pop concerts, including the world's busiest indoor venue, <a href="/wiki/The_O2_Arena" title="The O2 Arena">the O<sub>2</sub> Arena</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-422" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-422"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>413<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Arena" title="Wembley Arena">Wembley Arena</a>, as well as many mid-sized venues, such as <a href="/wiki/Brixton_Academy" title="Brixton Academy">Brixton Academy</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Hammersmith_Apollo" title="Hammersmith Apollo">Hammersmith Apollo</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Shepherd%27s_Bush_Empire" title="Shepherd&#39;s Bush Empire">Shepherd's Bush Empire</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-London&#39;s_Concerts_367-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-London&#39;s_Concerts-367"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>358<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Several <a href="/wiki/Music_festivals" class="mw-redirect" title="Music festivals">music festivals</a>, including the <a href="/wiki/Wireless_Festival" title="Wireless Festival">Wireless Festival</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lovebox_Festival" title="Lovebox Festival">Lovebox</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Hyde_Park,_London" title="Hyde Park, London">Hyde Park</a>'s <a href="/wiki/British_Summer_Time_(concerts)" title="British Summer Time (concerts)">British Summer Time</a>, are held in London.<sup id="cite_ref-423" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-423"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>414<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>The city is home to the original <a href="/wiki/Hard_Rock_Cafe" title="Hard Rock Cafe">Hard Rock Cafe</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Abbey_Road_Studios" title="Abbey Road Studios">Abbey Road Studios</a>, where <a href="/wiki/The_Beatles" title="The Beatles">the Beatles</a> recorded many of their hits. In the 1960s, 1970s and 1980s, musicians and groups like <a href="/wiki/Elton_John" title="Elton John">Elton John</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pink_Floyd" title="Pink Floyd">Pink Floyd</a>, <a href="/wiki/David_Bowie" title="David Bowie">David Bowie</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones" title="The Rolling Stones">the Rolling Stones</a>, <a href="/wiki/Queen_(band)" title="Queen (band)">Queen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Eric_Clapton" title="Eric Clapton">Eric Clapton</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Who" title="The Who">the Who</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Kinks" title="The Kinks">the Kinks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cliff_Richard" title="Cliff Richard">Cliff Richard</a>, <a href="/wiki/Led_Zeppelin" title="Led Zeppelin">Led Zeppelin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Iron_Maiden" title="Iron Maiden">Iron Maiden</a>, <a href="/wiki/Deep_Purple" title="Deep Purple">Deep Purple</a>, <a href="/wiki/T._Rex_(band)" title="T. Rex (band)">T. Rex</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Police" title="The Police">the Police</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elvis_Costello" title="Elvis Costello">Elvis Costello</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dire_Straits" title="Dire Straits">Dire Straits</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cat_Stevens" title="Cat Stevens">Cat Stevens</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fleetwood_Mac" title="Fleetwood Mac">Fleetwood Mac</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Cure" title="The Cure">the Cure</a>, <a href="/wiki/Madness_(band)" title="Madness (band)">Madness</a>, <a href="/wiki/Culture_Club" title="Culture Club">Culture Club</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dusty_Springfield" title="Dusty Springfield">Dusty Springfield</a>, <a href="/wiki/Phil_Collins" title="Phil Collins">Phil Collins</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rod_Stewart" title="Rod Stewart">Rod Stewart</a>, <a href="/wiki/Status_Quo_(band)" title="Status Quo (band)">Status Quo</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Sade_(band)" title="Sade (band)">Sade</a>, derived their sound from the streets and rhythms of London.<sup id="cite_ref-424" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-424"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>415<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-425" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-425"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>416<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>London was instrumental in the development of <a href="/wiki/Punk_music" class="mw-redirect" title="Punk music">punk music</a>, with groups such as the <a href="/wiki/Sex_Pistols" title="Sex Pistols">Sex Pistols</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Clash" title="The Clash">the Clash</a>, and fashion designer <a href="/wiki/Vivienne_Westwood" title="Vivienne Westwood">Vivienne Westwood</a> all based in the city.<sup id="cite_ref-426" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-426"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>417<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Other artists to emerge from the London music scene include <a href="/wiki/George_Michael" title="George Michael">George Michael</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kate_Bush" title="Kate Bush">Kate Bush</a>, <a href="/wiki/Seal_(musician)" title="Seal (musician)">Seal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Siouxsie_and_the_Banshees" title="Siouxsie and the Banshees">Siouxsie and the Banshees</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bush_(British_band)" title="Bush (British band)">Bush</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Spice_Girls" title="Spice Girls">Spice Girls</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jamiroquai" title="Jamiroquai">Jamiroquai</a>, <a href="/wiki/Blur_(band)" title="Blur (band)">Blur</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_Prodigy" title="The Prodigy">the Prodigy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gorillaz" title="Gorillaz">Gorillaz</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mumford_%26_Sons" title="Mumford &amp; Sons">Mumford &amp; Sons</a>, <a href="/wiki/Coldplay" title="Coldplay">Coldplay</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dido_(singer)" title="Dido (singer)">Dido</a>, <a href="/wiki/Amy_Winehouse" title="Amy Winehouse">Amy Winehouse</a>, <a href="/wiki/Adele" title="Adele">Adele</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sam_Smith_(singer)" class="mw-redirect" title="Sam Smith (singer)">Sam Smith</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ed_Sheeran" title="Ed Sheeran">Ed Sheeran</a>, <a href="/wiki/Leona_Lewis" title="Leona Lewis">Leona Lewis</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ellie_Goulding" title="Ellie Goulding">Ellie Goulding</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dua_Lipa" title="Dua Lipa">Dua Lipa</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Florence_and_the_Machine" title="Florence and the Machine">Florence and the Machine</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Scene_427-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Scene-427"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>418<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Artists from London played a prominent role in the development of <a href="/wiki/Synth-pop" title="Synth-pop">synth-pop</a>, including <a href="/wiki/Gary_Numan" title="Gary Numan">Gary Numan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Depeche_Mode" title="Depeche Mode">Depeche Mode</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Pet_Shop_Boys" title="Pet Shop Boys">Pet Shop Boys</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Eurythmics" title="Eurythmics">Eurythmics</a>; the latter's "<a href="/wiki/Sweet_Dreams_(Are_Made_of_This)" title="Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)">Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)</a>" was recorded in the attic of their north London home, heralding a trend for home recording methods.<sup id="cite_ref-428" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-428"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>419<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Artists from London with a Caribbean influence include <a href="/wiki/Hot_Chocolate" title="Hot Chocolate">Hot Chocolate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Billy_Ocean" title="Billy Ocean">Billy Ocean</a>, <a href="/wiki/Soul_II_Soul" title="Soul II Soul">Soul II Soul</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Eddy_Grant" title="Eddy Grant">Eddy Grant</a>, with the latter fusing <a href="/wiki/Reggae" title="Reggae">reggae</a>, soul and samba with rock and pop.<sup id="cite_ref-429" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-429"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>420<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> London is also a centre for urban music. In particular the genres <a href="/wiki/UK_garage" title="UK garage">UK garage</a>, <a href="/wiki/Drum_and_bass" title="Drum and bass">drum and bass</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dubstep" title="Dubstep">dubstep</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Grime_(music)" class="mw-redirect" title="Grime (music)">grime</a> evolved in the city from the foreign genres of <a href="/wiki/House_music" title="House music">house</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hip_hop_music" class="mw-redirect" title="Hip hop music">hip hop</a>, and reggae, alongside local <a href="/wiki/Drum_and_bass" title="Drum and bass">drum and bass</a>. Urban acts from London include <a href="/wiki/Stormzy" title="Stormzy">Stormzy</a>, <a href="/wiki/M.I.A._(rapper)" title="M.I.A. (rapper)">M.I.A.</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jay_Sean" title="Jay Sean">Jay Sean</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Rita_Ora" title="Rita Ora">Rita Ora</a>. Music station <a href="/wiki/BBC_Radio_1Xtra" title="BBC Radio 1Xtra">BBC Radio 1Xtra</a> was set up to support the rise of local <a href="/wiki/Urban_contemporary" class="mw-redirect" title="Urban contemporary">urban contemporary</a> music both in London and in the rest of the United Kingdom. The <a href="/wiki/British_Phonographic_Industry" title="British Phonographic Industry">British Phonographic Industry</a>'s annual popular music awards, the <a href="/wiki/Brit_Awards" title="Brit Awards">Brit Awards</a>, are held in London.<sup id="cite_ref-430" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-430"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>421<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Recreation">Recreation</h2></div>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Parks_and_open_spaces">Parks and open spaces</h3></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/Parks_and_open_spaces_in_London" title="Parks and open spaces in London">Parks and open spaces in London</a> and <a href="/wiki/Royal_Parks_of_London" class="mw-redirect" title="Royal Parks of London">Royal Parks of London</a></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_Sites_of_Special_Scientific_Interest_in_Greater_London" title="List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Greater London">List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Greater London</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_local_nature_reserves_in_Greater_London" title="List of local nature reserves in Greater London">List of local nature reserves in Greater London</a></div>

<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg/240px-Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg" decoding="async" width="240" height="160" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg/360px-Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg/480px-Hyde_Park_London_from_the_air.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456" /></a><figcaption><a href="/wiki/Hyde_Park,_London" title="Hyde Park, London">Hyde Park</a> (with <a href="/wiki/Kensington_Gardens" title="Kensington Gardens">Kensington Gardens</a> in the foreground) has been a popular public space since it opened in 1637.</figcaption></figure>

<p>A 2013 report by the <a href="/wiki/City_of_London_Corporation" title="City of London Corporation">City of London Corporation</a> said that London is the "greenest city" in Europe with 35,000 acres (14,164 hectares) of public parks, woodlands and gardens.<sup id="cite_ref-431" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-431"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>422<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> The largest parks in the <a href="/wiki/Central_London" title="Central London">central area of London</a> are three of the eight <a href="/wiki/Royal_Parks_of_London" class="mw-redirect" title="Royal Parks of London">Royal Parks</a>, namely <a href="/wiki/Hyde_Park,_London" title="Hyde Park, London">Hyde Park</a> and its neighbour <a href="/wiki/Kensington_Gardens" title="Kensington Gardens">Kensington Gardens</a> in the west, and <a href="/wiki/Regent%27s_Park" title="Regent&#39;s Park">Regent's Park</a> to the north.<sup id="cite_ref-432" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-432"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>423<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Hyde Park in particular is popular for <a href="#Sport">sports</a> and sometimes hosts open-air concerts. Regent's Park contains <a href="/wiki/London_Zoo" title="London Zoo">London Zoo</a>, the world's oldest scientific zoo, and is near <a href="/wiki/Madame_Tussauds" title="Madame Tussauds">Madame Tussauds</a> wax museum.<sup id="cite_ref-Tussauds_433-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Tussauds-433"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>424<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Primrose_Hill" title="Primrose Hill">Primrose Hill</a> is a popular spot from which to view the city skyline.<sup id="cite_ref-434" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-434"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>425<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>Close to Hyde Park are smaller Royal Parks, <a href="/wiki/Green_Park" title="Green Park">Green Park</a> and <a href="/wiki/St._James%27s_Park" class="mw-redirect" title="St. James&#39;s Park">St. James's Park</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-435" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-435"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>426<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> A number of large parks lie outside the city centre, including <a href="/wiki/Hampstead_Heath" title="Hampstead Heath">Hampstead Heath</a> and the remaining Royal Parks of <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Park" title="Greenwich Park">Greenwich Park</a> to the southeast, and <a href="/wiki/Bushy_Park" title="Bushy Park">Bushy Park</a> and <a href="/wiki/Richmond_Park" title="Richmond Park">Richmond Park</a> (the largest) to the southwest. <a href="/wiki/Hampton_Court_Park" title="Hampton Court Park">Hampton Court Park</a> is also a royal park, but, because it contains a palace, it is administered by the <a href="/wiki/Historic_Royal_Palaces" title="Historic Royal Palaces">Historic Royal Palaces</a>, unlike the eight <a href="/wiki/Royal_Parks_of_London" class="mw-redirect" title="Royal Parks of London">Royal Parks</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-436" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-436"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>427<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>Close to Richmond Park is <a href="/wiki/Kew_Gardens" title="Kew Gardens">Kew Gardens</a>, which has the world's largest collection of living plants. In 2003, the gardens were put on the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Educational,_Scientific_and_Cultural_Organization" class="mw-redirect" title="United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization">UNESCO</a> list of <a href="/wiki/List_of_World_Heritage_Sites_of_the_United_Kingdom" class="mw-redirect" title="List of World Heritage Sites of the United Kingdom">World Heritage Sites</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-437" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-437"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>428<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> There are also parks administered by London's borough Councils, including <a href="/wiki/Victoria_Park,_London" title="Victoria Park, London">Victoria Park</a> in the <a href="/wiki/East_End" class="mw-redirect" title="East End">East End</a> and <a href="/wiki/Battersea_Park" title="Battersea Park">Battersea Park</a> in the centre. Some more informal, semi-natural open spaces also exist, including <a href="/wiki/Hampstead_Heath" title="Hampstead Heath">Hampstead Heath</a> and <a href="/wiki/Epping_Forest" title="Epping Forest">Epping Forest</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Epping_438-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epping-438"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>429<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> both controlled by the <a href="/wiki/City_of_London_Corporation" title="City of London Corporation">City of London Corporation</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-439" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-439"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>430<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Hampstead Heath incorporates <a href="/wiki/Kenwood_House" title="Kenwood House">Kenwood House</a>, a former <a href="/wiki/Stately_home" class="mw-redirect" title="Stately home">stately home</a> and a popular location in the summer months when classical musical concerts are held by the lake.<sup id="cite_ref-440" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-440"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>431<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Epping Forest is a popular venue for various outdoor activities, including mountain biking, walking, horse riding, golf, angling, and orienteering.<sup id="cite_ref-Epping_438-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Epping-438"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>429<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Three of the UK's most-visited theme parks, <a href="/wiki/Thorpe_Park" title="Thorpe Park">Thorpe Park</a> near Staines-upon-Thames, <a href="/wiki/Chessington_World_of_Adventures" title="Chessington World of Adventures">Chessington World of Adventures</a> in Chessington and <a href="/wiki/Legoland_Windsor_Resort" title="Legoland Windsor Resort">Legoland Windsor</a>, are located within 20 miles (32&#160;km) of London.<sup id="cite_ref-441" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-441"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>432<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading3"><h3 id="Walking">Walking</h3></div>

<figure class="mw-default-size" typeof="mw:File/Thumb"><a href="/wiki/File:Horse_Ride,_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg/220px-Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg/330px-Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg/440px-Horse_Ride%2C_Wimbledon_Common_-_geograph.org.uk_-_692221.jpg 2x" data-file-width="640" data-file-height="480" /></a><figcaption>The Horse Ride is a <a href="/wiki/Tree_tunnel" title="Tree tunnel">tree tunnel</a> (route overhung by trees) on the western side of <a href="/wiki/Wimbledon_Common" title="Wimbledon Common">Wimbledon Common</a>.</figcaption></figure>

<p><a href="/wiki/Walking_in_London" title="Walking in London">Walking is a popular recreational activity in London</a>. Areas that provide for walks include <a href="/wiki/Wimbledon_Common" title="Wimbledon Common">Wimbledon Common</a>, <a href="/wiki/Epping_Forest" title="Epping Forest">Epping Forest</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hampton_Court_Park" title="Hampton Court Park">Hampton Court Park</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hampstead_Heath" title="Hampstead Heath">Hampstead Heath</a>, the eight <a href="/wiki/Royal_Parks" class="mw-redirect" title="Royal Parks">Royal Parks</a>, <a href="/wiki/Regents_Canal" class="mw-redirect" title="Regents Canal">Regents Canal</a> Walk, canals, and disused railway tracks.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_442-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-442"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>433<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Access to canals and rivers has improved recently, including the creation of the <a href="/wiki/Thames_Path" title="Thames Path">Thames Path</a>, some 28 miles (45&#160;km) of which is within <a href="/wiki/Greater_London" title="Greater London">Greater London</a>, and The <a href="/wiki/Wandle_Trail" title="Wandle Trail">Wandle Trail</a> along the <a href="/wiki/River_Wandle" title="River Wandle">River Wandle</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-443" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-443"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>434<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>Other <a href="/wiki/Long-distance_path" class="mw-redirect" title="Long-distance path">long-distance paths</a>, linking green spaces, have also been created, including the <a href="/wiki/Capital_Ring" title="Capital Ring">Capital Ring</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Green_Chain_Walk" class="mw-redirect" title="Green Chain Walk">Green Chain Walk</a>, <a href="/wiki/London_Outer_Orbital_Path" title="London Outer Orbital Path">London Outer Orbital Path</a> ("Loop"), <a href="/wiki/Jubilee_Walkway" title="Jubilee Walkway">Jubilee Walkway</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lea_Valley_Walk" title="Lea Valley Walk">Lea Valley Walk</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/Diana,_Princess_of_Wales_Memorial_Walk" title="Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial Walk">Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial Walk</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_442-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-442"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>433<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Sport">Sport</h2></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Sport_in_London" title="Sport in London">Sport in London</a></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Football_in_London" title="Football in London">Football in London</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rugby_union_in_London" title="Rugby union in London">Rugby union in London</a></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1273380762/mw-parser-output/.tmulti"><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner multiimageinner" style="width:219px;max-width:219px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:217px;max-width:217px"><div class="thumbimage"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg/215px-Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg" decoding="async" width="215" height="139" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg/323px-Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg/430px-Wembley_Stadium_interior.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2926" data-file-height="1885" /></a></span></div><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>, home of the England <a href="/wiki/England_national_football_team" title="England national football team">men</a> and <a href="/wiki/England_women%27s_national_football_team" title="England women&#39;s national football team">women's football team</a> and the <a href="/wiki/FA_Cup_Final" title="FA Cup Final">FA Cup Final</a>, has a seating capacity of 90,000. It is the UK's biggest stadium.<sup id="cite_ref-Wembley_444-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Wembley-444"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>435<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:217px;max-width:217px"><div class="thumbimage"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg/215px-Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="215" height="75" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg/323px-Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg/430px-Centre_Court_Wimbledon_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="280" /></a></span></div><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Centre_Court" title="Centre Court">Centre Court</a> at <a href="/wiki/The_Championships,_Wimbledon" class="mw-redirect" title="The Championships, Wimbledon">Wimbledon</a>. Held every June and July, Wimbledon is the oldest tennis tournament in the world, and the only major played on grass.</div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:217px;max-width:217px"><div class="thumbimage"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg" class="mw-file-description"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg/215px-Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg" decoding="async" width="215" height="155" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg/323px-Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3d/Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg/430px-Twickenham_stadium_-_Cup_finals_day_-_geograph.org.uk_-_2966637.jpg 2x" data-file-width="800" data-file-height="577" /></a></span></div><div class="thumbcaption"><a href="/wiki/Twickenham_Stadium" title="Twickenham Stadium">Twickenham</a>, home of the <a href="/wiki/England_national_rugby_union_team" title="England national rugby union team">England national rugby union team</a>, has a capacity of 82,000 seats.</div></div></div></div></div>

<p>London has hosted the <a href="/wiki/Summer_Olympic_Games" title="Summer Olympic Games">Summer Olympics</a> three times: in <a href="/wiki/1908_Summer_Olympics" title="1908 Summer Olympics">1908</a>, <a href="/wiki/1948_Summer_Olympics" title="1948 Summer Olympics">1948</a>, and <a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012</a>, making it the first city to host the modern Games three times.<sup id="cite_ref-IOC_42-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IOC-42"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>35<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> The city was also the host of the <a href="/wiki/Commonwealth_Games" title="Commonwealth Games">British Empire Games</a> in <a href="/wiki/1934_British_Empire_Games" title="1934 British Empire Games">1934</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-london_175_445-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-london_175-445"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>436<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> In 2017, London hosted the <a href="/wiki/2017_World_Championships_in_Athletics" title="2017 World Championships in Athletics">World Championships in Athletics</a> for the first time.<sup id="cite_ref-446" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-446"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>437<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>London's <a href="/wiki/Sport_in_the_United_Kingdom#Popularity" title="Sport in the United Kingdom">most popular sport</a> is <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">football</a>, and it has seven clubs in the <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2023%E2%80%9324_Premier_League" title="2023–24 Premier League">2023–24 season</a>: <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_F.C." title="Arsenal F.C.">Arsenal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Brentford_F.C." title="Brentford F.C.">Brentford</a>, <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a>, <a href="/wiki/Crystal_Palace_F.C." title="Crystal Palace F.C.">Crystal Palace</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fulham_F.C." title="Fulham F.C.">Fulham</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C." title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C.">Tottenham Hotspur</a>, and <a href="/wiki/West_Ham_United_F.C." title="West Ham United F.C.">West Ham United</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-london_176_447-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-london_176-447"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>438<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Other professional men's teams in London are <a href="/wiki/AFC_Wimbledon" title="AFC Wimbledon">AFC Wimbledon</a>, <a href="/wiki/Barnet_F.C." title="Barnet F.C.">Barnet</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bromley_F.C." title="Bromley F.C.">Bromley</a>, <a href="/wiki/Charlton_Athletic_F.C." title="Charlton Athletic F.C.">Charlton Athletic</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dagenham_%26_Redbridge_F.C." title="Dagenham &amp; Redbridge F.C.">Dagenham &amp; Redbridge</a>, <a href="/wiki/Leyton_Orient_F.C." title="Leyton Orient F.C.">Leyton Orient</a>, <a href="/wiki/Millwall_F.C." title="Millwall F.C.">Millwall</a>, <a href="/wiki/Queens_Park_Rangers_F.C." title="Queens Park Rangers F.C.">Queens Park Rangers</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Sutton_United_F.C." title="Sutton United F.C.">Sutton United</a>. Four London-based teams are in the <a href="/wiki/Women%27s_Super_League" title="Women&#39;s Super League">Women's Super League</a>: <a href="/wiki/Arsenal_W.F.C." title="Arsenal W.F.C.">Arsenal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C._Women" title="Chelsea F.C. Women">Chelsea</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Hotspur_F.C._Women" title="Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Women">Tottenham</a>, and <a href="/wiki/West_Ham_United_F.C._Women" title="West Ham United F.C. Women">West Ham United</a>.

</p><p>Two <a href="/wiki/Premiership_Rugby" title="Premiership Rugby">Premiership Rugby</a> union teams are based in Greater London: <a href="/wiki/Harlequin_F.C." title="Harlequin F.C.">Harlequins</a> and <a href="/wiki/Saracens_F.C." title="Saracens F.C.">Saracens</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-448" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-448"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>439<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Ealing_Trailfinders_Rugby_Club" title="Ealing Trailfinders Rugby Club">Ealing Trailfinders</a> and <a href="/wiki/London_Scottish_F.C." title="London Scottish F.C.">London Scottish</a> play in the <a href="/wiki/RFU_Championship" title="RFU Championship">RFU Championship</a>; other rugby union clubs in the city include <a href="/wiki/Richmond_F.C." title="Richmond F.C.">Richmond</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rosslyn_Park_F.C." title="Rosslyn Park F.C.">Rosslyn Park</a>, <a href="/wiki/Westcombe_Park_RFC" title="Westcombe Park RFC">Westcombe Park</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Blackheath_F.C." title="Blackheath F.C.">Blackheath</a>. <a href="/wiki/Twickenham_Stadium" title="Twickenham Stadium">Twickenham Stadium</a> in south-west London hosts home matches for the <a href="/wiki/England_national_rugby_union_team" title="England national rugby union team">England national rugby union team</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-musiccap_449-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-musiccap-449"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>440<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> While <a href="/wiki/Rugby_league" title="Rugby league">rugby league</a> is more popular in the north of England, the sport has one professional club in London&#160;– the <a href="/wiki/London_Broncos" title="London Broncos">London Broncos</a> who play in the <a href="/wiki/Super_League" title="Super League">Super League</a>.

</p><p>One of London's best-known annual sports competitions is the <a href="/wiki/Wimbledon_Championships" title="Wimbledon Championships">Wimbledon Tennis Championships</a>, held at the <a href="/wiki/All_England_Lawn_Tennis_and_Croquet_Club" title="All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club">All England Club</a> in the south-western suburb of <a href="/wiki/Wimbledon,_London" title="Wimbledon, London">Wimbledon</a> since 1877.<sup id="cite_ref-450" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-450"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>441<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> Played in late June to early July, it is the oldest tennis tournament in the world and widely considered the most prestigious.<sup id="cite_ref-451" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-451"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>442<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-452" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-452"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>443<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p><p>London has two <a href="/wiki/Test_cricket" title="Test cricket">Test cricket</a> grounds which host the <a href="/wiki/England_cricket_team" title="England cricket team">England cricket team</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lord%27s" title="Lord&#39;s">Lord's</a> (home of <a href="/wiki/Middlesex_County_Cricket_Club" title="Middlesex County Cricket Club">Middlesex C.C.C.</a>) and <a href="/wiki/The_Oval" title="The Oval">the Oval</a> (home of <a href="/wiki/Surrey_County_Cricket_Club" title="Surrey County Cricket Club">Surrey C.C.C.</a>). Lord's has hosted four finals of the <a href="/wiki/Cricket_World_Cup" title="Cricket World Cup">Cricket World Cup</a> and is known as the <i>Home of Cricket</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-453" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-453"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>444<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> In golf, the <a href="/wiki/Wentworth_Club" title="Wentworth Club">Wentworth Club</a> is located in <a href="/wiki/Virginia_Water" title="Virginia Water">Virginia Water</a>, Surrey on the south-west fringes of London, while the closest venue to London that is used as one of the courses for <a href="/wiki/The_Open_Championship" title="The Open Championship">the Open Championship</a>, the oldest major and tournament in golf, is <a href="/wiki/Royal_St_George%27s_Golf_Club" title="Royal St George&#39;s Golf Club">Royal St George's</a> in Sandwich, Kent.<sup id="cite_ref-454" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-454"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>445<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Alexandra_Palace" title="Alexandra Palace">Alexandra Palace</a> in north London hosts the <a href="/wiki/PDC_World_Darts_Championship" title="PDC World Darts Championship">PDC World Darts Championship</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Masters_(snooker)" title="Masters (snooker)">Masters</a> <a href="/wiki/Snooker" title="Snooker">snooker</a> tournament. Other key annual events are the mass-participation <a href="/wiki/London_Marathon" title="London Marathon">London Marathon</a><sup id="cite_ref-455" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-455"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>446<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/University_Boat_Race" class="mw-redirect" title="University Boat Race">University Boat Race</a> on the Thames contested between <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Boat_Club" title="Oxford University Boat Club">Oxford</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cambridge_University_Boat_Club" title="Cambridge University Boat Club">Cambridge</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-456" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-456"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>447<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup>

</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Notable_people">Notable people</h2></div>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="Notes">Notes</h2></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1239543626"><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">

<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">

<li id="cite_note-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Greater_London" title="Greater London">London region</a></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-5">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/London_metropolitan_area" title="London metropolitan area">London metropolitan area</a></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-9"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-9">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><span class="rt-commentedText nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups noexcerpt" lang="en-fonipa"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/English" title="Help:IPA/English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="/ˈ/: primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="&#39;l&#39; in &#39;lie&#39;">l</span><span title="/ʌ/: &#39;u&#39; in &#39;cut&#39;">ʌ</span><span title="&#39;n&#39; in &#39;nigh&#39;">n</span><span title="&#39;d&#39; in &#39;dye&#39;">d</span><span title="/ən/: &#39;on&#39; in &#39;button&#39;">ən</span></span>/</a></span></span>, <a href="/wiki/Help:Pronunciation_respelling_key" title="Help:Pronunciation respelling key"><i title="English pronunciation respelling"><span style="font-size:90%">LUN</span>-dən</i></a><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8"><span class="cite-bracket">&#91;</span>6<span class="cite-bracket">&#93;</span></a></sup></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-10">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">London is socially considered a city due to its physical and cultural signifance. However, it has not been legally granted by the Crown as having <a href="/wiki/City_status_in_the_United_Kingdom" title="City status in the United Kingdom">city status</a>.</span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-13"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-13">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">See also: <a href="/wiki/Independent_city#National_capitals" title="Independent city">Independent city § National capitals</a></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-18">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Greater London Authority consists of the <a href="/wiki/Mayor_of_London" title="Mayor of London">Mayor of London</a> and the <a href="/wiki/London_Assembly" title="London Assembly">London Assembly</a>. The London Mayor is distinguished from the <a href="/wiki/Lord_Mayor_of_London" title="Lord Mayor of London">Lord Mayor of London</a>, who heads the <a href="/wiki/City_of_London_Corporation" title="City of London Corporation">City of London Corporation</a> running the <a href="/wiki/City_of_London" title="City of London">City of London</a>.</span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-37">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">According to the <a href="/wiki/Eurostat" title="Eurostat">European Statistical Agency</a> (Eurostat), London had the largest <a href="/wiki/Larger_Urban_Zones" class="mw-redirect" title="Larger Urban Zones">Larger Urban Zone</a> in the EU. Eurostat uses the sum of the populations of the contiguous urban core and the surrounding commuting zone as its definition.</span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-349"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-349">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Imperial College London was a constituent college of the University of London between 1908 and 2007. Degrees during this time were awarded by the federal university; however, the college now issues its own degrees.</span>

</li>

</ol></div></div>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2"><h2 id="References">References</h2></div>

<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1239543626"><div class="reflist">

<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">

<li id="cite_note-auto1-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-auto1_1-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-auto1_1-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/archives/view/no1poultry_molas_2007/">Number 1 Poultry (ONE 94), Museum of London Archaeology, 2013</a>. Archaeology Data Service, The University of York.</span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-ONS_mid-year_pop_est-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ONS_mid-year_pop_est_3-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a <li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation magazine cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.forbes.com/pictures/edgl45ghmd/no-1-london">"The World's Most Influential Cities 2014"</a>. <i>Forbes</i>. 14 August 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-gla-plan-2015-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-gla-plan-2015_39-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.london.gov.uk/what-we-do/planning/london-plan/current-london-plan/london-plan-chapter-two-londons-places/policy-22">"The London Plan (March 2015)"</a>. <li id="cite_note-blackwell-55"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-blackwell_55-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFVince2001" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1">Vince, Alan (2001). <li id="cite_note-69"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-69">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFBurgon1839" class="citation book cs1">Burgon, John William (1839). <i>The Life and Times of Sir Thomas Gresham, Founder of the Royal Exchange: Including Notices of Many of His Contemporaries. <li id="cite_note-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-70">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.thestage.co.uk/long-reads/from-pandemics-to-puritans-when-theatre-shut-down-through-history-and-how-it-recovered">"From pandemics to puritans: when theatre shut down through history and how it recovered"</a>. <i>The Stage.co.uk</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-auto2-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-auto2_85-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-auto2_85-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFCoispeau2016" class="citation book cs1">Coispeau, Olivier (2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Yor4DAAAQBAJ"><i>Finance Masters: A Brief History of International Financial Centers in the Last Millennium</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-Sales-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Sales_86-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Sales_86-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFWhite" class="citation news cs1">White, Matthew. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220522225623/https://www.bl.uk/georgian-britain/articles/the-rise-of-cities-in-the-18th-century">"The rise of cities in the 18th century"</a>. British Library. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">11 June</span> 2022</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=The+rise+of+cities+in+the+18th+century&amp;rft.aulast=White&amp;rft.aufirst=Matthew&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bl.uk%2Fgeorgian-britain%2Farticles%2Fthe-rise-of-cities-in-the-18th-century&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALondon" class="Z3988"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-103"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-103">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFBracken2011" class="citation book cs1">Bracken, Gregory B. <li id="cite_note-192"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-192">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.standard.co.uk/comment/london-city-pigeons-tiktok-misunderstood-b1191267.html">"The London Question: Are pigeons misunderstood?"</a>. <i>Evening Standard</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-:1-209"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-:1_209-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-:1_209-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200702033916/https://www.trustforlondon.org.uk/data/population-age-groups/">"The Age Distribution of the Population"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Trust_for_London" title="Trust for London">Trust for London</a></i>. 20 April 2020. <li id="cite_note-Census2021-210"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Census2021_210-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/populationandmigration/internationalmigration/bulletins/internationalmigrationenglandandwales/census2021#:~:text=London%20has%20remained%20the%20region,had%20a%20non%2DUK%20passport">"International migration, England and Wales: Census 2021"</a>. <li id="cite_note-317"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-317">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation pressrelease cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://tfl.gov.uk/info-for/media/press-releases/2019/august/victoria-coach-station-to-remain-major-coach-hub">"Victoria Coach Station to remain major coach hub"</a> (Press release). <li id="cite_note-336"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-336">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFWalker2024" class="citation news cs1">Walker, Peter (8 March 2024). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2024/mar/08/health-gains-of-low-traffic-schemes-up-to-100-times-greater-than-costs-study-finds">"Health gains of low-traffic schemes up to 100 times greater than costs, study finds"</a>. <i>The Guardian</i>. <li id="cite_note-354"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-354">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFTruelove2016" class="citation web cs1">Truelove, Sam (13 October 2016). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.croydonadvertiser.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife/11-famous-former-pupils-you-432659">"11 of the most famous people who studied at Croydon's BRIT School"</a>. <i>Croydon Advertiser</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-373"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-373">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.timeout.com/london/shopping/british-boot-company">"British Boot Company: Shopping in Camden Town, London"</a>. <i>Time Out</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-393">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110830193512/http://theblitzkids.com/site_archive/theblitzkids/menuboy.html">"Boy George"</a>. <li id="cite_note-musiccap-449"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-musiccap_449-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation pressrelease cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080625050620/http://www.rfu.com/microsites/twickenham/index.cfm?StoryID=14822">"RFU apply for two additional concerts at Twickenham Stadium in 2007"</a> (Press release). Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.rfu.com/microsites/twickenham/index.cfm?StoryID=14822">the original</a> on 25 June 2008.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=RFU+apply+for+two+additional+concerts+at+Twickenham+Stadium+in+2007&amp;rft.pub=Twickenham+Rugby+Stadium&amp;rft.date=2006-10-03&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.rfu.com%2Fmicrosites%2Ftwickenham%2Findex.cfm%3FStoryID%3D14822&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALondon" class="Z3988"></span></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-450"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-450">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080423182334/http://www.wimbledon.org/en_GB/index.html">"Wimbledon&#160;— official website"</a>. The All England Tennis and Croquet Club (AELTC). Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.wimbledon.org/en_GB/index.html">the original</a> on 23 April 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 April</span> 2008</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Wimbledon+%E2%80%94+official+website&amp;rft.pub=The+All+England+Tennis+and+Croquet+Club+%28AELTC%29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.wimbledon.org%2Fen_GB%2Findex.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALondon" class="Z3988"></span></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-451"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-451">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFClarey2008" class="citation news cs1">Clarey, Christopher (7 May 2008). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/05/sports/tennis/05wimbledon.html">"Traditional Final: It's Nadal and Federer"</a>. <i>The New York Times</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 July</span> 2008</span>. <q>Federer said[:] 'I love playing with him, especially here at Wimbledon, the most prestigious tournament we have.'<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span></q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+New+York+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Traditional+Final%3A+It%27s+Nadal+and+Federer&amp;rft.date=2008-05-07&amp;rft.aulast=Clarey&amp;rft.aufirst=Christopher&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2008%2F07%2F05%2Fsports%2Ftennis%2F05wimbledon.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALondon" class="Z3988"></span></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-452"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-452">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite id="CITEREFWill_Kaufman_&amp;_Heidi_Slettedahl_Macpherson2005" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1 cs1-prop-long-vol">Will Kaufman &amp; Heidi Slettedahl Macpherson, ed. (2005). "Tennis". <i>Britain and the Americas</i>. Vol.&#160;1&#160;: Culture, Politics, and History. ABC-CLIO. p.&#160;958. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&#160;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-85109-431-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-85109-431-8"><bdi>978-1-85109-431-8</bdi></a>. <q>this first tennis championship, which later evolved into the Wimbledon Tournament ... continues as the world's most prestigious event.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Tennis&amp;rft.btitle=Britain+and+the+Americas&amp;rft.pages=958&amp;rft.pub=ABC-CLIO&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-85109-431-8&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ALondon" class="Z3988"></span></span>

</li>

<li id="cite_note-453"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-453">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238218222"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.espncricinfo.com/england/content/ground/57129.html">"Lord's (Cricket Grounds)"</a>. <ul><li><a href="/wiki/Londinium" title="Londinium">Londinium</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Anglo-Saxon_London" title="Anglo-Saxon London">Lundenwic</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/City_of_London" title="City of London">City of London</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/City_of_Westminster" title="City of Westminster">City of Westminster</a></li>

<div class="navbox-styles"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236075235"></div><div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="Governance_of_Greater_London175" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th scope="col" class="navbox-title" colspan="2"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1239400231"><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Governance_of_Greater_London" title="Template:Governance of Greater London"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Governance_of_Greater_London" title="Template talk:Governance of Greater London"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a href="/wiki/Special:EditPage/Template:Governance_of_Greater_London" title="Special:EditPage/Template:Governance of Greater London"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Governance_of_Greater_London175" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Governance of <a href="/wiki/Greater_London" title="Greater London">Greater London</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/City_of_London" title="City of London">City of London</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Greater_London" title="Greater London">Greater London</a></li>

<li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">London</a></li></ul>

</div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Regional</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Greater_London_Authority" title="Greater London Authority">Greater London Authority</a>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/London_Assembly" title="London Assembly">London Assembly</a></li>

<li><a href="/wiki/Tehran" title="Tehran">Tehran</a></li></ul>

</div></td></tr></tbody></table><div></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;padding:0.35em 1.0em; line-height:1.1em;">Europe (4)</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1980_Summer_Olympics" title="1980 Summer Olympics">1980</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union"><img alt="Soviet Union" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_Soviet_Union.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Moscow" title="Moscow">Moscow</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1984_Summer_Olympics" title="1984 Summer Olympics">1984</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1235" data-file-height="650" /></a></span></span> Los Angeles</li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1988_Summer_Olympics" title="1988 Summer Olympics">1988</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/South_Korea" title="South Korea"><img alt="South Korea" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg/45px-Flag_of_South_Korea_%281984%E2%80%931997%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Seoul" title="Seoul">Seoul</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1992_Summer_Olympics" title="1992 Summer Olympics">1992</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain"><img alt="Spain" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/23px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/35px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/45px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="750" data-file-height="500" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Barcelona" title="Barcelona">Barcelona</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1996_Summer_Olympics" title="1996 Summer Olympics">1996</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1235" data-file-height="650" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Atlanta" title="Atlanta">Atlanta</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2000_Summer_Olympics" title="2000 Summer Olympics">2000</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia"><img alt="Australia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="256" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Sydney" title="Sydney">Sydney</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2004_Summer_Olympics" title="2004 Summer Olympics">2004</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Greece" title="Greece"><img alt="Greece" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/23px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/35px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/45px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400" /></a></span></span> Athens</li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics" title="2008 Summer Olympics">2008</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/China" title="China"><img alt="China" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/45px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> London</li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil"><img alt="Brazil" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/22px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png" decoding="async" width="22" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/33px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/43px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1000" data-file-height="700" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics" title="2020 Summer Olympics">2020</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Japan" title="Japan"><img alt="Japan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/35px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/45px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> Tokyo<sup>[c3]</sup></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics" title="2024 Summer Olympics">2024</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/France" title="France"><img alt="France" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600" /></a></span></span> Paris</li>

<li><i><b><a href="/wiki/2028_Summer_Olympics" title="2028 Summer Olympics">2028</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1235" data-file-height="650" /></a></span></span> Los Angeles</i></li>

<li><i><b><a href="/wiki/2032_Summer_Olympics" title="2032 Summer Olympics">2032</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><span class="mw-image-border" typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia"><img alt="Australia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="12" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="512" data-file-height="256" /></a></span></span> <a href="/wiki/Brisbane" title="Brisbane">Brisbane</a></i></li></ul>

</div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div><sup>[c1]</sup> Cancelled due to <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">World War I</a>; <sup>[c2]</sup> Cancelled due to <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">World War II</a>; <sup>[c3]</sup> Postponed to 2021 due to the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
